column2: MONTANA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. Regulatory signs:
column4: regulate the flow of traffic at school zone.
column6: are diamond shaped and yellow or green.
column10: provide information about the road rules and traffic laws.

column2: 2. You are driving behind another vehicle and notice that the driver is driving with one hand, talking to a passenger. You as a driver:
column4: know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing his safety margin by being an inattentive driver.
column6: know that you should give the vehicle ahead extra room.
column8: know that you should avoid this bad habit.

column2: 3. When the pavement is marked with a double yellow line, drivers may pass other vehicles:
column4: only if there are no oncoming vehicles.
column6: only if the vehicle ahead is driving 10 mph or more under the speed limit.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
5. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 6. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 7. Parking is not allowed:
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 8. Work zone signs:
column4: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column6: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column8: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.
column10: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.

column2: 9. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.
column6: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.
column8: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.

column2: 10. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
11. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
12. Railroad crossings should always be considered:
column4: safe when railroad crossing lights are active.
column6: a place where stopping is required.

column2: 13. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.
column6: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.

column2: 14. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
15. Emergency vehicles:
column4: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column2: 16. The yield sign means:
column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column6: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 17. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 18. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
19. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
20. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column8: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 21. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
23. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 24. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 25. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
26. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column8: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 27. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column8: there is a school zone after the curve.
column10: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 28. This sign means:
column8: Stay on the main highway if possible
column10: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

30. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
31. A red traffic signal light means that you must:
column4: where there is no stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection.
column8: when there is no stop line, stop before entering any crosswalk.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column10: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow
